address: Stefanyka St, 3, L'viv, L'vivs'ka oblast, Ukraine, 79000

reviews.text: Lviv is a very conservative city that has sacrificed its soul to tourism. Don't expect to find "non-conformist" places, "degenerate" creative spaces (like in Kyiv or Odessa) or have a chance to attend post-punk or electro-punk concerts. The underground subversive avant-garde in Lviv is absent. "Modern" art in Lviv is mostly when an antique shop window hasn't been restored since 1912: it's "urban patina", but shh, don't say it too loudly, for fear that it becomes trendy!

Has very interesting artwork and paintings. It’s a nice place to visit also at site is very pretty to take pictures. However there wasn’t much in the backyard there are a lot of parts but the explanation of the parts are not in a very detailed.
It’s a really great place to be sure and relax and just have a look enjoys art and get a feel of

saw artist bringing paintbrush to actually try to copy the painting and I am impressed by how much the gallery encourage people doing that! Good job on this

I really enjoyed this gallery wonderful art from the Ukrainian art scene it's a very quiet museum and you can take your time  enjoying all the museum has to offer.
The good thing is that there is also English explanations in each painting which is a little bit rare to find in the museums in Lviv.
Also I need to point out that this is one of the most expensive museums in the City compared to the others it's approximately 150 local currency.
Wonderful collection, of v early works, up to the 20thC. You see Lviv and Ukraine for what they are: Central European.

Tickets are not cheap, but I highly recommend to pay. This is great place with enormous number exceptional paintings. There are a lot of works od art from Polish artist, for instance Matejko, Malczewski. The staff is kind. Interior is interesting. I was delighted.
